page.title: 04home life
page.content: Mr.Johnston was born in 1909 in Rossglass.He lived in Rossglass for a while and then moved to Killough. He went to school in Legamaddy until he was 14.Then he left school and went to look for a job.As school was hard he was glad to get out.He went to work as a motor mechanic.He got Â£2.00 for his salary.Times have changed from those dayThere was no discos or youth clubs.Food was bought from one of the local shops such as Gibsons and Montgomereys or from a van.The Killough brickyard was the only factory in the area and still is. Mr. Johnston now 76 still remembers when a boat was wrecked in the harbour and coal was washed up onto the sand. He also remembered when the harbour was used as a smuggling base.
